content: brain eater fish dice bag materials needed worsted weight yarn - two different shades of blue or color of your choice white red black & yellow hooks - 5 5mm for body and 4 5mm for all other parts scissors yarn needle stitch marker beads or button for drawstring abbreviations used magic_ring - magic_ring half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet slip_stitch - slip_stitch chain - chain increase - increase decrease - decrease fo - fasten_off single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet st - stitch each round is joined with a slip_stitch chain 1 at the beginning of each round/row does not count as the first stitch unless otherwise noted numbers inside are the stitch count for each round body 5 5mm hook in darker shade of blue 1 half_double_crochet 8 into magic_ring slip_stitch to join chain 1 2 half_double_crochet around 8 slip_stitch to join chain 1 3 increase half_double_crochet around 12 slip_stitch to join chain 1 4 half_double_crochet around 12 slip_stitch to join chain 1 5 increase half_double_crochet x2 around 16 slip_stitch to join chain 1 6 half_double_crochet around 16 slip_stitch to join chain 1 7 increase half_double_crochet x3 around 20 slip_stitch to join chain 1 8 increase half_double_crochet x4 around 24 slip_stitch to join chain 1 9 increase half_double_crochet x5 around 28 slip_stitch to join chain 1 10 half_double_crochet around 28 slip_stitch to join chain 1 11 increase half_double_crochet x6 around 32 slip_stitch to join chain 1 12 half_double_crochet around 32 slip_stitch to join chain 1 13 increase half_double_crochet x7 around 36 slip_stitch to join chain 1 14 half_double_crochet around 36 slip_stitch to join chain 1 15 increase half_double_crochet x8 around 40 slip_stitch to join chain 1 16-19 half_double_crochet around 40 slip_stitch to join chain 1 on rounds 16-18 20 chain 3 counts as 1st double_crochet double_crochet into remaining 39 st 40 slip_stitch to top of chain 3 to join chain 1 21 single_crochet around 40 slip_stitch to join fo weave in end attach white into any st with a slip_stitch 22 chain 1 single_crochet into same st as chain single_crochet into next st *half_double_crochet x2 into next st double_crochet-picot-double_crochet into next st half_double_crochet x2 into next st single_crochet next two st* repeat between * * for a total of eight teeth each tooth should be separated by two single_crochet after the last half_double_crochet of tooth #8 slip_stitch into the first single_crochet fo & weave in ends here you will be switching to red for this round you will be working over round 22 white and into round 21 blue i hope this makes sense the stitches will go over top of the white but will be worked into the stitch holes of round 21 attach red with a slip_stitch into round 21 below the first of any set of 2sc of white 23 chain 1 single_crochet into same st as chain and into the next st slip_stitch into the next 3 st repeat this *2 single_crochet 3 slip_stitch* all the way around slip_stitch to join to the first single_crochet fo weave
